did.unittitle: Mary L.D. Ferris papers on the history of Gramercy Park
did.abstract: One bound volume containing clippings and notes presumably compiled by Mary L.D. Ferris, as well as correspondence to and from Ferris, relating to the history of the Manhattan neighborhood of Gramercy Park. Materials in the volume span the period circa 1898 to 1921 and focus particularly on the origin of the neighborhood's name.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1973.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One bound volume containing clippings and notes presumably compiled by Mary L.D. Ferris, as well as correspondence to and from Ferris, relating to the history of the Manhattan neighborhood of Gramercy Park. Materials in the volume span the period circa 1898 to 1921 and focus particularly on the origin of the neighborhood's name.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Gramercy Park is a neighborhood on the East Side of Manhattan. Originally called Krom Moerasje (little crooked swamp) by Dutch settlers, it was renamed Gramercy by the English. In the early 19th century, the swamp was drained and streets were laid out in an English style around a private park, leading to the present-day name of the neighborhood.
